website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive wireless printer that puts through a lot of paper in a short amount of time. This is the printer for students looking to save time and money.
pros: Prints fast on both sides of the paper
Deep paper tray holds almost a full ream
cons: Once the ink starts to get low, it will stop printing
Some users turn off deep sleep mode to keep it connected to WiFi

customer_reviews.title: Easy WiFi set-up.  No more inkjet scam!!!
customer_reviews.text: Brother HL-L2350DW model. Great product. Set up in minutes. Just pressed the WiFI button on the printer and the WPS button on my modem - and the printer recognized it instantly. Looking forward to saving $$$ by not having to buy inkjet cartridges for my old Epson NX415 - which was constantly telling me that I needed to replace the color cartridges even though I had NEVER printed anything but BLACK. What a sham. No more inkjet scam for me. This Brother laser printer prints in black only (which is what I need), seems to be well made, and fits nicely on my desk (smaller than the old Epson). So far I am a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has great reviews , so I bought it. I spent 5 hours on a telephone , over 2 days, with the Brother technicians , and in the end they blamed the ISP. So I emailed back and with them over a couple day period, and they could not find any thing wrong with the ISP they provide. I then bought the cheapest Canon printer I could find ,[ $29 ] and I set it up the first time thru, with no problems. I have been around computers and printers for 25 years, and never had a problems I had this Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G. Dollerd

customer_reviews.title: Never a Brother again
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 24 hours. Could not get it set up. The meager instructions were for multiple printers so had a hard time figuring out what was specific to my model. After too long of a time experimenting, I finally arrived at the point to enter my wifi password to enable the printer (yes, that antiquated method was their only option.) It would NOT allow me to use capitalized letters or symbols. I called for support but the person on the end of the line had no idea how to help. I returned the printer and will never touch a Brother product again.
customer_reviews.author: P Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare Setup
customer_reviews.text: These do not come with the USB hookup necessary to skirt the frustrating WiFi process, and things magically work hours after you've tried to set it up. The printer functions as expected and the print quality is high, but this WiFi device was a painful nightmare to set up. Help articles on the online support didn't address any of the errors or issues we were having, and the tiny display for setup on our router was a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: BUY A CORD - not a paid review.
customer_reviews.text: this thing is actually great for the price. it prints both sides. and is super affordable for a home printer. toner seems good for now. meaning its not too expensive. but the sleep mode BLEEPING SUCKS. don't bother connecting to wifi. spend the extra 20 dollars and save yourself screaming at your computer and printer alternatively, whether at the printer for NOT responding to your computer, or your computer for the piss poor google search answers on how to get your printer not out of DEEP sleep but just regular sleep. this is not a paid advertisement. this unit would be 70% less stressful if they just included a cord. the end.
customer_reviews.author: nerd_up

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiet setup.  Wrong Toner Cartridge
customer_reviews.text: 1. It seems the printer was shipped with the wrong toner cartridge. The cartridge fit but the printer message screen said "Wrong Toner". Couldn't continue with the setup. I had to purchase the correct cartridge. I replaced the cart then was able to continue the wireless setup. 2. Wasn't the easiest setup. The setup instructions in the Quick Setup Guide didn't match what the driver installation was doing. 3. The CUPS option was not available for Mac OS-X (10.11) 4. Amazon was willing to refund the order, if I returned the entire package.. I choose not to.
customer_reviews.author: jad

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Set Up! Don't buy unless you already know how to set it up
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Set Up! Don't buy unless you already know how to set it up It took me many hours to figure out how to set up the printer. Much more complicated than Hp I had. It doesn't have a screen to show you the tabs. When you put in wifi password, you have to dial from 1 to z.... It's a stupid design and very time costly.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: I loved this printer for the first 8 or so months I had it. Suddenly, it stopped connecting to the network. Two days and several hours, and it finally connected again. Great! A few weeks later the same problem happened. Now I'm stuck with a printer that doesn't want to connect to a network. When it works, it works great. Zero complaints, except for when it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: D. Web

customer_reviews.title: May the Gods be with you when you set up WiFi printing
customer_reviews.text: This is a capable little printer once you get it connected to WiFi. I'm running Mac OS 10.14. Getting it to connect after I first bought it was a total nightmare. I've since moved and have a new router so I'm going through the nightmare again. The set-up wizard finds my router with no problem but it won't connect. The 271-page user's manual is no help. Brother's online support is no help. I just ordered a USB A to B cable and will try an alternate connection method. I hope the Gods are with me. Otherwise, this capable little printer goes into the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Pinkerton

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation for iPhone, iPad, Mac
customer_reviews.text: The most seamless, straight-forward wireless printer setup I have ever experienced. After years of suffering through HP configuration Hell with other WiFi printers, I tried this. I have had very reliable service from two Brother Fax machines over the last twenty years, so I gave this (HL-L2350DW) a try. A reliable wireless printer for under $100? Yes, but the best part was the simplicity of installing it wirelessly. I just followed the single-sheet instructions and installed it in under 10 minutes! TAKE THAT, HP! Immediately, I was printing from my iOS devices and Macintoshes from all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: CPDay

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to set up an even more difficult to keep awake.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to set up an even more difficult to keep awake. One of the worst products I’ve ever purchased. My brother said it up for me but we can’t get it to work with my Wi-Fi. The only way I can make it print is to use a cable connected to my computer. It just constantly goes into sleep mode before you can follow the set up instructions. Tech-support? What tech support? I would never recommend this product to anyone not even my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Printer is always asleep, cannot print or Airprint
customer_reviews.text: The printer is always asleep. I bought this so my parents can Airprint from their iPads. But it never shows up when they select Airprint! So I have to use my desktop Mac to send a test print to "wake" the printer. I've used Brother printers for 10+ years, and this is the worst piece of junk I've ever purchased from them. I've tried the settings that people have recommended to keep it awake, but it doesn't work. And the very idea of having to change settings to get it to try to get the advertised Airprint compatible mode is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: S. Suwatanapongched

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last four months!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working as of July 17, barely four months old. Bought it to replace an older Brother model that gave up the ghost after years of good service. This one developed a problem with leaking toner creating smudged and unusable copies. The multi-step process that would supposedly clean out the head could not be completed. Had to scrap this one and by another brand. Did not bother with warranty because the printer is needed on a daily basis and could not afford to be without while Brother did its song and dance about sending it back to the factory for repair. Brother used to be a much better product. Their new models do not measure up!
customer_reviews.author: Gail Sebern

customer_reviews.title: I Will Not Buy Brother Again
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Wi-Fi at home; now the printer won't connect. I really gave it a chance with Brothers's driver/setup software. Error after error; the feedback it gave me is my Wi-Fi is too fast. That deep sleep mode is so frustrating. Not being able to wake it up by pressing any button on the panel is such a design oversight that I will never buy this brand again. Worked well when it worked. Looking for a new printer now.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Faull

customer_reviews.title: Never buy Brother printers
customer_reviews.text: This printer requires that you use Genuine Brother Toner Cartridges at three times the price. If you install any cartridge other than Brother your printer will not work!!! BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leona L Bramlett

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased at Christmas but didn't need to use it for almost a month. I truly regret not taking it out of the box and using it immediately. At first printing was okay. Okay but not good because there were these grooves in the paper from the rollers. I thought huh, weird. Then I printed out a 200 plus document and okay went to crap. The odd grooves turned every page thick and unruly to handle. I wanted to return, too late. I shoved down my anger and went to print again it repeatedly jammed then when I cleared it it jammed on absolutely nothing. Regret this purchase times 10
customer_reviews.author: Booklover of all kinds

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage. Suddenly stopped working and doesn't turn on anymore. A very expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often but this printer has to be the worst I have ever owned. Purchased about half a year ago and after countless connection issues this thing just decided to randomly turn off and never come back. Tried several power-cycling-guides I found but nothing. Don't buy this "printer".
customer_reviews.author: An avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Say no to HP
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge HP fan for a long time. Once you have a brother in your life, you won't come back. This thing is super easy to set up, prints really quickly, it's bullet proof, and I've never changed the toner. The cart that came with it lasted me a Associates degree and a half. This is my second brother. I have to so I can print twice as fast. It's so good my parents ask me to print stuff for them. So I bought two.
customer_reviews.author: happy peeps

customer_reviews.title: Hear good stuff, and it's anything but good.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it prints fast, yes it prints both sides and yes you can easily print from any device. BUT what's the point if every time you want to print the printer is locked in sleep mode and you have to unplug and plug in again. I'm giving this a one so others see it's main flaw and don't fall for it. If it didn't lock up in sleep mode it would easily get a 4 star, with a possible upgrade down the line, if it held up. Device used mainly at home, for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Borz

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I can’t stand this printer!!!!! Once it goes into sleep mode, my computer gives me this failure error and I have to trouble shoot just to print! I got it working once but am experiencing the same error again! I’m want to return this POS!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lawhorn

customer_reviews.title: Flips circuit and is unusable
customer_reviews.text: Every time I use this, it flips the circuit breaker and I lose power in the entire office. I've tried everything, including unplugging everything but the printer, to no avail. I called Brother help, but after 30 minutes on hold with super aggressive and loud piano music (I like piano music as much as anyone, but this was like serial killer background music), I hung up. I then did a live chat, which took 20 minutes to get a rep and went very slowly. Finally, she finally told me I had to call the customer service line. There is not help here.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awful UI
customer_reviews.text: Simply awful UI. The little (I mean miniscule) LCD display is no bigger than the profile of a small paper clip. Then the manner which you toggle between choices is so unintuitive that it is easy to get to the point of frustration to change simple settings like "page printing on both sides" and the like. Overall a good value but at the price of loss productivity. Not a good biz product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rough first impression but easy setup and working with Windows and iOS won me over
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Very easy to setup. Works with my iOS devices without any special software. Two sided printing works well. The Bad: Plug and Play driver wasn't found with Windows 7. The Brother support site had the correct driver. The Ugly: First printouts had huge streaks and globs of toner. I was almost ready to return the printer. I carefully removed the extra toner from the drum using a microfiber cloth. Afterwards there were not further globs of toner. This was a packaging fail for Brother. Both the drum and toner were shipped in the same vacuum sealed bag where the toner cartridge leaked onto the drum.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Lousy job on envelopes
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this specifically to print envelopes, which the instructions say are easy to do, and what it is Bill for. Well, if you want envelopes with addresses that have streaks and shadows, then this is your printer. Then run your finger over the printed area on the envelope and the toner streaks. Now, maybe just printing on typing paper it is fine. But it was useless for envelopes. And in fact, the single feeder got stuck several times feeding the envelopes. actually went back to a cheaper inkjet printer and that did a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyk58

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience with printers ever!  Please read the negative ratings. They are real
customer_reviews.text: Spent over four hours trying to get printer to connect (both wireless and cabled) with no success. Learned that Brother's doesn't work with Arris Routers??? Why not disclosed that info? Also each time I tried to download the updated drivers, it triggered my circuit breaker and shut down all my computer equipment. I tried on different ciruct and it did the same thing. I am returning it since you can't get any help via chat or live nor does the troubleshooting page help. Sorry I tried this.
customer_reviews.author: WAG

customer_reviews.title: Working Printer - YES!
customer_reviews.text: This is a printer, not a 'do everything' device and it PRINTS WELL!! I have had both HP and Canon printers that promised to function as printers, scanners, copiers and fax machines! They both failed at various points in their lives' times! I bought this as a DEDICATED PRINTER, nothing else, and it works beautifully (ahhhh)! I also bought a dedicated scanner, called an Epson WorkForce ES-50 (i.e. for the same reason) and will soon (hopefully) find the same results with it. If you want a 'no BS printer', for which you need not take out a second mortgage on your house to purchase, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: TAT

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding home printer. Here's what to know!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding printer for your home. I have gone through countless horrible inkjet printers, and wish I had used this years ago. When setting up the printer, I recommend skipping all of the instructions and just adding your wireless network manually. Entering in the password will be a pain, but it will allow you to skip installing a bunch of unnecessary software. Once it's on your WiFi, you're good to go. Also, see the review by Winnie NG about how to turn off Deep Sleep and extend the use of your toner.
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect printer if you do not need color
customer_reviews.text: The product comes well packaged and it is an affordable, functional and low maintenance printer. If you do not need color printing, this is perfect as the toner is cheap, and it does not dry like an ink cartilage. Also a great choice if you print high volume in B&W. It prints on both sides of the paper, also, you can print directly from your iPhone or iPad. The only complain is that it is painful to type you wifi password with the small buttons, but luckily you will not have to do it often, so it deserves 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor

customer_reviews.title: A great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this and other similar Brother printers for years, and I've been very happy with them. Originally, I bought them because they're compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux (I use all three). No, they don't last forever and eventually things go wrong (usually with the paper feed mechanism). But you can't beat them for the price. Also, you can get generic toner replacements for under $20 on Amazon, which is important if you print a lot but aren't a millionaire. (Thanks, Brother, for not forcing your customers to buy proprietary toner!) Really, I wouldn't even consider another brand at this point.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Oh, do I wish I hadn't purchased this printer!
customer_reviews.text: No. 1 - after I print something, the printer goes into sleep mode; then a few minutes later I want to print another page, and I have to turn off the machine, then restart it. Why can't the printer just stay on until I turn it off myself??? No. 2 - I didn't know the cartridges cost as much as the printer cost - that's so totally ridiculous. I wish I could return the printer for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaA

customer_reviews.title: What A Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought it back in Sept and yes; it is their cheapest one and if you ever want to TALK with support; "fuggitaboutit". Changed internet providers and it will NOT work with AT&T. The printer will not connect to the internet. If I ever get it going it will be a miracle. I worked with AT&T net support, they couldn't help me, but if you happen to buy their cheapest (for home use), you will not get the phone number for help. They just keep sending you back to "download software", or their "product support center". IT'S NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: MinOne

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 2 months after purchase - does not turn on. Disable deep sleep mode!
customer_reviews.text: Follow instructions from other reviews here to disable deep sleep mode. With deep sleep mode enabled, this printer will refuse to wake to print no matter what and it would be a hassle to wake it every time. I purchased this in July 2020, and it stopped turning on after 2 months (no physical damage, no power outages). I followed instructions and support online to unplug it and hold down the power button while plugging the printer back in and nothing worked. Tried multiple times with different outlets. Amazon is sending me a replacement now, but I would not recommend buying this!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Ho

customer_reviews.title: A WORKHORSE
customer_reviews.text: I have ownedthree of these over the years. Let me tell you a short story. When I w worked in Silicon Valley at Cisco Systems I talked to a lot of engineers. One day i asked what kind of printers they were using because i Needed a new one. Everyone chimed in, saying get the Brother Laser printer. I've owned one ever since. Brother, makes this little printer a WORKHORSE.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Trouble printing envelopes
customer_reviews.text: The HL-L2350dw wrinkles envelopes unless you open the back door and press down on two green tabs. This must be done each time you wish to print envelopes, as soon as you close the back door the green tabs return to their up position. For my use, this downgrades the printers usability as that is way to much trouble to do every other letter I print. I'm currently print envelopes on another printer to get by. May decide to see this one back.
customer_reviews.author: ajaac

customer_reviews.title: DON'T PURCHASE IF YOU WANT TO PRINT ENVELOPES
customer_reviews.text: Printer works fine for everyday printing. Can print from iPhone/iPad while out on porch. Works fine with my 10 year old Mac. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS IF YOU WANT TO PRINT ENVELOPES. Just unbelievable trying to print envelope. You have to manually feed them one at a time. Directions say insert envelope into slot paper guides until the front edge touches the paper feed roller. You can't tell when envelope touches feed roller so envelope is inserted to far. That causes a "inside paper jam". You then have to open front and clear the jam.
customer_reviews.author: CDU

customer_reviews.title: Updated review  - 2nd machine works great
customer_reviews.text: I returned the Brother HL-L2350DW because I was getting a clack strip of ink along one side. The new printer came quicker than advertised and works like a charm. Great print quality. Fast. ------------- I am returning this Brother HL-L2350DW because every print has a black strip on the side of it. I am not finding any help online. Return seems to be only option. I bought the $76 refill, so I am going to try again before I give up on this brand. Will see how smoothly the return and replacement goes. If all goes well I will update the review and improve the score.
customer_reviews.author: joe marketing

customer_reviews.title: installation instructions VERY poor
customer_reviews.text: Written instructions are not enough to connect wirelessly. You need to call support. The instructions do not include any menu information. Seems to work once it is installed, but I am sorry I bought this. Have had to call support for installation. Why can't the developers and tech writers get it together???
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKS, UNRELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money. Customer support is terrible, nobody ever answers calls, website will only redirect you to downloading the same stupid thing over and oer again. Printer never prints on command. Sleep/deep sleep mode will only deactivate when printer is powered off/on. Printer will say "Ready" , with items active in queue, AND STILL NOT PRINT. Quality is good when this pos decides it wants to work. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Unfixable error while still on its first ink cartridge
customer_reviews.text: We print very little in our home, but decided to spend a little extra on a laser printer. This machine malfunctioned a couple months after its 1 year warranty, but while still on its first ink cartridge. Out of warranty, Brother offered no help once basic over-the-phone support failed. Maybe we were just unlucky with our machine, but I would hesitate to buy Brother again.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D

customer_reviews.title: Decent print quality - Terrible software
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a compact printer for USB use, this is a good printer However the software is useless and WiFi software are terrible. The WiFi setup is a nightmare (I have many years of network/WiFi experiace) Sad to see that A USB cable is not provided. They *really* want you to use their APP... Yep another firm trying to get to use their APP.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Joe

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Printer works great majority of the time. I do have the occasional hiccup where I am unable to print but it usually starts working again once I restart the printer. It did take me awhile (30 minutes to an hour) for the initial setup and I do consider myself to be tech savvy, but otherwise I am very happy with this printer. I love being able to wireless print. I usually print from my Chromebook and iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: Really want to love it but I don't
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is great - the quality, compact, looks nice and clean, however, my printer CONSTANTLY looses connection with Wi-Fi, because if I don't use it for a couple of days due to work travel or such, and all of a sudden I need to print something, my computer can't locate the printer and I need to turn the router, printer everything off, wait for few mins and plug it all in, but if you need your printer right away is this an option? Not for me
customer_reviews.author: OBum

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay first few times. Though the printing wait time was too long.. many times printed multiple cooies of the same. Despite that I did not return it. But I am annoyed with the wifi connection problem it has. Wifi signal is strong and everything else works. But this damn piece does not get connected.
customer_reviews.author: priyanka

customer_reviews.title: Not so great nor wireless
customer_reviews.text: 1 missing star for the sleep mode. Often the wireless doesn't print immediately but 30min or 1 hr later. 2 missing another star for not compatible with Mac. 3. missing another star for not compatible with Android tablet. 4. missing another star for not compatible with multiple wifi networks. E.g. if your house has 2 wifi, it can only connect to 1 wifi.
customer_reviews.author: swp

customer_reviews.title: Bricked by low toner warning. Bricked!
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned, there will come a day not long after you buy this printer where it will be bricked by a warning of low toner, even though it was printing fine right before. Seriously this is true and there is nothing you can do to reset it on this model. Brother took the choice away from their customers of replacing their toner cartridge when they please. Brother toner is hilariously expensive. I'm not convinced that generic varieties will work due to DRM. I have some generics on the way. We will see if they work.
customer_reviews.author: peanut salesman

customer_reviews.title: Initial cartridge exhausted after 336 page count
customer_reviews.text: The printer is reasonably priced. However, the initial setup was painful - as you have work using a 16x1 LCD display and two arrow keys for everything. Imagine the hell you have to work through typing SSID and WPA2/TKIP passkeys! My main gripe is that the printer exhausted in 336 page print - despite using draft, economy and 200 dpi print quality settings. If you don't use the printer on a daily basis, you can expect a low yield - but 1/4th of the advertised yield (1200 pages for TN630) is too low.
customer_reviews.author: Sam V

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a few months then NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked well at the beginning. I loved it. I could print from my phone. Then a few months later, it started having issues. No matter how many times I restarted it, it wouldn't work. It was so finicky, sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't. Even when I used their program to print, printer is not detected. Find another printer, this is an absolute nightmare
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Failed In Less Than A week
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer to replace our old LaserJet, and it was great - for the 4 days that it worked. It worked wirelessly and was able to connect to all of our devices at the same time. On the 5th day, however, it just refused to connect to any device. And also during this period, the app told us the printer had an update, but the link to it led to a 404 page. Great for the few days it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with this printer-
customer_reviews.text: New Bro. printer (HL-L2350DW) arrived & in place - so far it is as expected & advertised - a first report was written when I received & installed the new printer- fast forward to last week & ink cartridge change needed & purchased from amazon & done this morning... With the new cartridge TN-760 printing is good once again- Now tho the 'WiFi' indicator light blinks non stop.... not good....How do I shut the shut the D... unwanted light off? With this experience, I wouldn't buy this printer again...amazon did their usual good job in the sales part of this for me- Not a happy customer Brother corp.- Dave Richardson
customer_reviews.author: Dave Richardson

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Print and Toner vs. ink cartridge are great!
customer_reviews.text: Took me several hours to complete the WiFi connection process, but I'm 62 yrs.old and somewhat illiterate when it comes to the details. Once I got past that, I have been seriously happy. Hoping that the toner feature is going to make the ink jet cartridge an old painfully expensive memory!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Sue

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Printing Bad Option
customer_reviews.text: We have several other printers (Canon, Epson) connected via Wifi at our business and all work great. We needed another printer and went with the cheaper Brother option. I would not recommend this printer if trying to print via Wifi connection, there is about a 50/50 chance the printing will work if trying to print via Wifi. Would have given it a 2.5 star rating if that was an option. Otherwise decent product design, it is compact and easy on the eyes. Works as described and prints well IF you are directly connected.
customer_reviews.author: H D

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Black and White Wireless Laser Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Brother wireless laser printer that I've owned and I'm quite happy with it so far. It only seems to be able to connect to my wifi network using 2.4 GHz and if you don't use WPS or aren't broadcasting your SSID entering your network name and password using the few buttons on the control panel is a hassle but beyond that, it's great so far. Setup was a snap for Windows 10 and I like that it prints duplex (double-sided) automatically. I'd definitely recommend this for an inexpensive b&w laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: JEB

customer_reviews.title: Now a big paperweight
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 5 months and now it's just a big paperweight that won't even turn on. Wish I would have believed the reviews and never bought it. $90 wasted. Keep your money and look at another printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience, huge waste of time, negligent service from Brother
customer_reviews.text: After two days the printer went into "Deep Sleep" mode and could not be woken up from it. I called Brother and they verified that the printer was not communicating with my computer and the solution for the problem was for me to buy a cable and forget about wireless printing. The Brother representative said there could be many reasons for the communication problem but that "there was nothing wrong with the printer." She did agree that the solutions she knew for this problem did not work in my case, and that this was not an isolated incident. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: James Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Silent, dependable, efficent - WiFi is a apin to set up initially - but that's it.
customer_reviews.text: Set up is a pain in the butt. You will need to connect it to your PC/Mac with a cable, download the set-up and get it connected to your WiFi. Then, unplug it, set it wherever you like, plug it back in - and it's dependable, fast, silent, efficient and robust as any printer you could ever want. Bear in mind- if you ever change your password or network name; the setup for reconnecting to the printer will again be a pain in the butt. But, seriously - how often do you do that? Mine sits quietly in the corner of the office; and works when needed. It does it's job well, silently and dependably.
customer_reviews.author: J. Halvorson

customer_reviews.title: Love Brother Printers
customer_reviews.text: So the big appeal we were looking for in this particular purchase was compatibility with AirPrint. We needed to be able to print wirelessly from our (many) Apple devices in the home. Of course, we also wanted decent print quality and Brother delivers on all points. Granted, the printer itself feels a bit cheap and light compared to earlier model years but, the price is very well justified. Setup was easy! Recommend you install with a USB attached and then simply disconnect after all is installed and you will find a seamless experience. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: John E. Litton

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the delivery people
customer_reviews.text: I looked at our video camera and wasn't pleased with how they delivered/treated our printer during delivery. They obviously didn't care it was a printer and/or how rough they were when they somewhat dropped it to the ground and then it fell onto its side. The printer works right now but I'm even more aware if anything goes wrong within the warranty time-frame, I'm definitely going to wonder if this was the cause. I haven't used all the functions yet, but it paired fairly easily compared to other printers I've used before.
customer_reviews.author: J & R

customer_reviews.title: It's fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it mentioned ability to do cardstock. In the manual it said it only goes to 65 lb which is thinner than normal cardstock. When I went to install it I noticed that it the same printer as my other one which I bought a few years ago and have been happy with. . Works great, well documented, was pretty easy to set up. Had a problem where it would not wake up from deep sleep which I was unable to fix. So I did a workaround by disabling the deep-sleep mode. So I have 2 of these and if I needed another printer I'd buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Turek

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap laser printer, and sure enough, I got one. I mainly use this to print labels and, unfortunately, it jams CONSTANTLY. Not only that, it doesn't print straight 90% of the time. I've wasted so many labels and envelopes due to uneven printing and jams. I do NOT recommend this printer. I would advise you to spend a little more money and get something of better quality. There's a reason this printer is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Decent compact printer.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and doesn't take a lot of shelf space. Prints pretty quickly without too much noise. The starter toner it comes with has pretty low capacity. I'm struggling to get it even close to the 700 sheets they advertise. You must manually toggle the "continue" option for printing with low toner (and do this before you have to!). And set the toner saver option. Update: with the "continue" and toner save options, I got the starter toner cartridge to print 841 pages before the prints got too streaky and faint. Just swapped the toner for a non-OEM replacement. Update 2: 16 months later... got 3000+ pages out of the Arthur toner replacement
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M.

customer_reviews.title: Brother installer fails on latest macOS
customer_reviews.text: The Brother installer (MonoLaserPRT17_UW_104.dmg) fails on macOS 10.13.4 (i.e. the latest version as of 2018-04-14). You can print using the default macOS driver, but wireless printing doesn't work because you can't configure it. Forget about AirPrint and Google Cloud Print as well.
customer_reviews.author: approach

customer_reviews.title: How the mighty have fallen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office after having a hl-2270DW at my house for years (still have it actually). That thing was a beast - great print quality, great connectivity, etc. i've gotten the new printer to work but it's finicky. It doesn't have an Ethernet port so you have to rely on it's wireless connection. Some things print with skewed scaling. If they had just upgraded the 2270dw with a small screen for error messages and a less cumbersome method of printing diagnostic pages, performing factory reset - this would've been perfect. Unfortunately, the mark was missed.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a dynamo for a small office.
customer_reviews.text: Efficient ink usage, prints very quickly. Large capacity paper tray for its size. Most importantly in the 2 years or so I have owned it with 5 people printing on it all day, it hasn't had a single hiccup. A breath of fresh air compared to the horrendous HP Office pro it replaced. I think you would struggle to find a small office work horse that's better than this machine. If you need super high quality images printed, look else where but that's not what this machine is for. I cant stress enough how well it does its job of spitting out documents all day. I will rue the day it dies, probably in about 2045.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is good and it holds a reasonable amount of paper. Set-up was not a breeze, but I never got so frustrated that I wanted to throw it across the room. It has a weird quirk in that it sometimes won’t print for a day or two. I can shorten the time by just unplugging it, replugging it, and restarting my computer. But that’s a pain in the ass. For some things, I press [print], nothing happens, and then a day or two later it will finally decide to print. If I’m not in a hurry, I’ll just leave it and wait the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Useless after a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer 2 years ago. Worked great for a year and a half. It’s been basically useless for the last few months. Constantly on sleep mode, not discoverable on WiFi anymore, bought a plug to connect to my laptop manually which worked once and now it’s completely useless. Doesn’t work at all anymore. It’s constantly in Sleep mode. I’ve tried everything. Reset the Sleep mode timer etc. On top of that, the customer service is non-existent. A shame because it was great for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a B/W laser printer
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need color and just print often this is a great choice. Really easy wireless setup. Great print quality. Good build quality, doesn't seem cheap or flimsy. Supposed to get about 1300 or so pages out of a toner cartridge that costs the same as an inkjet cartridge set which gives maybe 300 to 400 if your printing low quality. For some it might be a bit loud, fan noise. It does have a quiet mode but I haven't tried it, doesn't bother us in our home office.
customer_reviews.author: Redned

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, Unreliable Printer -- It never connects!
customer_reviews.text: I had to trouble shoot this printer dozens of times to get it to connect to wifi. Also, when I use the hardline USB to connect to my laptop, sometimes the printer will wake up out of sleep mode and other times it won't. Infuriating!!! DON"T BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: s.p.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low cost printer
customer_reviews.text: While the set-up instructions leave a bit to be desired, once it's settings are established, the printer has excellent quality print. I have a linux operating system, so I had to download the driver from the Brother site. The directions for that were complicated but worked fine. I like the toner save mode for printing throwaway pages. There are a number of instructions on the net on how to bypass the generic toner use prohibition that Brother has introduced on this model. It's easier to live with than HP printer toners and the toner lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Blokeman

customer_reviews.title: Lovely, quiet, and quick.
customer_reviews.text: *I haven’t used tech support yet so I left it blank* I LOVE LOVE THIS PRINTER!!! For basic printing, which is what I bought it for, it’s amazing. Crisp, clear lettering and images. Black and white but that’s ok. Also it prints incredibly fast but quietly. It makes noise but by the time u expect to be “printing” u realize it had already printed haha. Soooo fantastic. I use this for school since I’m online and all books are online. Sometimes I like to have hard copy of chapter to read or whatnot. This printer makes that easy and the crispness of the printing makes for less headaches when reading. 10/10 would recommend/buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alice W

customer_reviews.title: Connecting wifi was a Royal Pain
customer_reviews.text: I just finished the endless ordeal of connecting it to my home wifi network. This took over 30 minutes of frustration and not knowing wtf was running, downloading, installing, or otherwise going on as there is a royal mess of popup windows that are hard to follow. I work in IT and am used to being patient with low-usability software, otherwise I'd probably have given up and just connected a cable. I took two stars off for the experience, because in addition to the crappy setup wizard, the printed instructions don't reflect what happens on this printer when I followed them, and were essentially useless. Thank the demigods for Windows in all it's reliable glory.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger root

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Can't use aftermarket ink and IT SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: I am never buying another Brother printer EVER. From deep sleep to not being able to use inexpensive toner, Brother SUCKS. DON'T BUY THIS. Update: Owned this for 11 months, replaced the toner several times (with non-Brother toner, wasn't paying ridiculous prices) and got a drum error. Based on how much I hated this printer, I didn't bother attempting a warranty claim, I threw it in the trash. I will never purchase another Brother product as long as I live. These products are poorly designed and not consumer friendly in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Mikehill33

customer_reviews.title: Most important is that it works well.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I disliked was the setup instructions. I found it fairly easily to do the actual hands-on portion of setting up the printer. Thereafter, it became difficult to follow do the printer set-up and troubleshooting. It was also difficult to find the correct phone number to call for assistance. I finally Googled the corporation and things went extremely well with the Brother employee that helped me put missing Drivers on and fine tune something as small as ensuring paper guides were properly clicked. Many thanks to the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complicated, but great.
customer_reviews.text: Once you finish setting up the wifi it works great. I can even manage the printer from my phone. The problem is getting it to work. I tried everything. The printer itself was connected to wifi, but no device could see it. I ended up having to unplug/replug my router during setup... Kind of a nightmare, but now it works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Woundheir

customer_reviews.title: The best laser printer I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have a $800 Dell color laser printer at home but I needed a cheap laser printer for my office. The reviews were mostly good so I gave it a shot. After I received it I couldn't use it because it didn't come with a cable. So I had to buy a cable and after that came it worked wonderfully. I have a MacBook and I just plugged it in and instantly my computer recognized it and installed the drivers automatically. The double sided printing comes in handy but best of all it prints FAST! They just shoot out of it. Very happy!! Don't listen to the haters, they're probably using it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Logan D.

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to inkjet
customer_reviews.text: Replaced one of those printers with 4 different ink colors that constantly runs out of ONE color, causing you to spend lots of money and be annoyed. I honestly print about 50 pages a year, and I felt like I had an issue with my less than year old Epson printer EVERY time. So I got this instead which so far has been absolutely flawless and fast. It's black and white but honestly what the $%#^# would I need to print in color anyway?? Get rid of the headache of those inkjet printers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for school, great for quick prints. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Yo this printer is really good. I’ve had a few tech issues but YouTube has solved almost every problem. I also haven’t changed the toner since I bought it a year ago. Really look up how to override the low toner function and get every drop out of that first toner cart. If you can get it to print even when it tells ya there isn’t toner, you’ll get a lot out of it. Also I dropped it slightly while moving furniture and it is just fine and dandy. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Samantha McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Fast double sided printing, setup instructions not clear
customer_reviews.text: I love this. So glad I got a printer with toner rather than ink because I don't print a lot and inks always dry out so fast. The setup instructions are NOT clear at all so I had to have my IT daughter come over to set it up. Once set up though, it is super easy to print wirelessly from my HP laptop and my iPhone 6S. Love being able to print documents whenever I want without concern of dried out cartridges. AND it does double sided printing!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Run far away from purchasing electronics on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING REMOTELY ELECTRONIC FROM AMAZON. Every single thing I have purchased in the last year totally craps out after 3 months and is then past their return window. I have wasted HOURS of my life with support and this particular issue is still not resolved. I now have to deal with the manufacturer and go to a repair center ONE STATE AWAY to address the fact that it will not power on. I am SO OVER AMAZON. Time to pull my Prime plug.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: The Inkjet killer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! 99 trillion times better than a stupid inkjet printer! Set up was very easy for me and I felt that thrilling rush when the first thing I tried printed out great and fast! This is SO much better than an inkjet! I will NEVER EVER buy an inkjet printer again! I never print color photos at home and who does? The quality of photos from an inkjet isn't that good anyway if you do, and that is the ONLY reason to have an inkjet. This printer makes me happy! And hey - even if you don't want to buy this GREAT printer do yourself a favor and buy a laser printer instead of those crappy inkjets!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry J.

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Previous Model
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model of this printer for many years; eventually as with mechanical devices it began to fail to print as easily as it had. The most significant aspect of these printers is that they deliver B/W prints, without the cost and bother of mutiple color cartridges. For most jobs B/W is just fine; the overall saviings are significant, and the interval for changing the toner is much longer than with the color printers. This model runs faster and quieter than the previous one, and shuts down automatically after use, saving electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Small, prints well
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an old Brother unit, and it is an improvement. Small, easy enough to setup (using CUPS on FreeBSD). Knocking down one star because sometimes -- rarely -- a sheet can get stuck inside and is a pain to remove. I suppose, all printers have this problem -- and there is no 5-star rated one out there...
customer_reviews.author: Doofus

customer_reviews.title: Fast but where is the toner ink?
customer_reviews.text: This is a brand new printer and after 10 great pages the print has lightened up as though the printer is out of ink. This did not get better after shaking and rocking the toner cartridge many difficult times. This is disappointing. I ordered a new toner cartridge and hopefully this will solve the problem. The printer looks nice, funtions well, prints fast on both sides of the paper, preset. I just wish they gave you more toner as a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic, never-jams, compact, good price, toner carts seem to last indefinitely.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a 24x36 color high-res of your childhood home well then unfortunately this isn't for you. However, if you've got 83 pages of 8.5x11 to print and have just minutes to clock-out then you'll be glad you got the HL-L2350DW saddled up. Fitting on the top of a small blue milk-crate because your office is basically half inside a loading dock, this utilitarian design will serve you well for years to come. 'Ol reliable is what I'll be telling my grandchildren when I pass it down to them.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Goolan

customer_reviews.title: Great printer once setup for wifi.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer once I got it setup for wifi. The instructions/videos leave out important points. This is my third Brother 23xx. Prior to setting up I looked at YouTube and Brother setup video/instructions. Setup still took me two hours, and I am not sure I could do it again. Took off one star because of setup.
customer_reviews.author: ander

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 16 months. Even before it stopped working, I also dealt with the issue that others talked about here... it would go to sleep and then, in order to print, I'd have to manually turn it off then turn it on again. I live in a small space and so it's tucked under a desk, and this was super annoying. I finally put the VERY expensive ink charger in it b/c the initial ink ran out. It prints fine, great! A week later I go to print something again, and this piece of junk won't turn on. Just completely dead. So frustrating. I'm not optimistic that there's better options on the market but I won't buy brother again.
customer_reviews.author: cspdx

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Brother printer I've had. The last one was a multifunction printer. All have had toner issues that prevented the units from working properly. This one, after three months of use, suddenly decided to stop recognizing the toner cartridge, which is almost entirely full. It keeps saying that I need to replace the toner cartrige and refuses to print, no matter how many times I've reinstalled the cartridge or inserted a new one. Tech support is nonexistent. Try a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Turn off Deep Sleep Mode and Set printer settings to continue mode!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer back in Feb 2020 (Had for about 6 months now) and was dealing with deep sleep mode since. It didn't bother my hubby but it bothered me haha! And i came back to the reviews and this kind person shared knowledge for everyone on fixing this! I highly recommend finding that post and following the directions given! Post is by woman named by: Winnie NG (should be top review!) Anyhow the printer works well for our needs :D
customer_reviews.author: Jessana

customer_reviews.title: WiFi is very difficulty to setup
customer_reviews.text: You have to download the "full package" from their support site. Then use the crap utility via a temp USB cable to configure it half way to at least get the wifi password entered, which fails after that step, then dig thru the print settings on the printer to find what IP was assigned, and use windows print manager to manually configure the new printer via wifi... :-(
customer_reviews.author: Alwyn S

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer and bought this one after looking at reviews on a few separate occasions. The instructions are clear cut. There is little miscellany in the box which made deciding what was important obvious. I have already printed both from my email and iphone wirelessly after setting it all up (took about an hour including rearranging my office a bit). YES, the printer comes with ink. That was one question I had and it took a bit of searching to find. A good buy so far!
customer_reviews.author: ireadreviews

customer_reviews.title: Still not working right
customer_reviews.text: Set up has been a nightmare. It finds a wrong wireless connection every time. After tinkering off & on for days I went back to my old, slower Canon. Once holidays are over I will start again with the usual telephone bs & printing off or downloading way more pages of a manual in fine print & probably 5 languages trying to solve it. For sure the entry mode is set for tinier & much younger fingers than mine. I have a very old, simple, slowwww Brother that I have loved so I am beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lwwhite

customer_reviews.title: Does come with ink!
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy, I was able to add it to my home wifi directly through the printer menu. I will point out the single line of text that can display on the tiny little display is definitely not as convenient as my Canon with its large color screen. But that doesnt effect the quick printing and costs savings I get with this laser printer! I will also note that in the basic printer package, it DOES come with a toner cartridge! I bought one extra cuz I thought it needed it, but I could have saved myself a little money. It will get used so Im not sweating it. I hope this thing lasts many years!
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: This printer is always ready and works!
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of the battle with inkjet printers and cartridges always needing replaced as well and heads cleaned every time we needed to print something. This printer is sitting on a desk across the room out of the way and just works when needed...every time! I would like to note that it was a pain and slightly confusing to initially set up the WiFi connection but once done, it has been rock solid. It also is not that responsive when printing from a cell phone, but almost all printing is done from a computer, so it is mostly irrelevant.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk -- Always had trouble waking from sleep, but now it has slipped into a coma.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has always had problems waking from sleep when I print something. Often the print queue is jammed/stuck with some document that can't be deleted. I usually end up uninstalling and then reinstalling it every time I need to use it. Now, after about a year, it won't even start up any more. People complain about Brother and their print cartridge management system, but I never even made it to the end of one cartridge. Absolutely my last Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but annoying sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: The printer is fabulous because it's got great quality for black and white, the tray can hold an entire ream of paper, and it can print double sided without you having to flip the pages. The blue tooth was easy to set up and it works like a charm once it wakes up. My only issue is, when it goes to sleep, I often have to unplug it to wake it back up. Then it works wonders... oh, and the ink is a reasonable price too.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Gal

customer_reviews.title: Fast, hassle-free printing. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Love the small footprint of this little printer and the speed of the output. Got feed up with the cost of color ink cartridges on my old Canon Pixma and, most of all that the model I had required all the color tanks to have at least some ink in them or it wouldn’t print just monochrome. Stupid! For my uses it is just easier and much cheaper to go to Staples or some such and have anything I want printed in color done there. The set up on the Brother was easy and I love being able to print from my iPad wirelessly. Very happy I bought this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Judi R. Halford

customer_reviews.title: 3 Toners in 3 Months!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on November 16, 2018. The starter toner lasted a few weeks before needing to be replaced. The 2nd Toner was supposed to last 3,000 pages. On, February 4, 2019, I had to replace that toner for a 3rd toner. There is no way I was even close to 3,000 pages. It's been 3 days, and now the printer is again saying that the toner needs to be replaced. This is ridiculous! (All toners used were genuine brother toners.)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quality printing!
customer_reviews.text: Never had a laser printer before. I've only ever had a copy machine. My last copy machine is a color, HP copier from 2011. This Brother printer, however, may only be in black and white, but the text print quality is amazing! Also, it is so fast! In like 1 or 2 mins it spit out 60+ pages! Agan, amazing! In less than a second it spits out like 1 or 2 papers. Just incredible! Not too big or heavy a machine either. The wifi printing from my phone is also great. Great price, great performance! Love this printer, and it's another one of my best purchases from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: TwistedChains

customer_reviews.title: This printer doesn't include a scanner; just black and white printing
customer_reviews.text: The printing is nice; I switched to a laser printer because my old inkjet dried out and needed refilled each use. However, I didn't realize this printer isn't also a scanner. I'm pretty bummed out I got the wrong one. The WiFi wasn't very intuitive or easy to set up, but it works. I'm happy the ink will never dry out no matter how infrequently I use it. I was planning on using it to scan documents, so I'm upset it wasn't more clearly mentioned in Amazon's comparison tool.
customer_reviews.author: N. Martin

customer_reviews.title: A very fast printer!
customer_reviews.text: It is very fast. It is monochromatic and it does not copy. However, I believe that I will spend less on ink than I did with my color printer. I didn’t print photos so it was wasteful. I do miss not being able to copy. It works very well with printing from my phone and IPad. I’m looking for a way to scan with my phone and then print. I’m sure that it can be done. The printing doesn’t run, when it gets wet. I’m very satisfied with the Brother Compact Monochrome Laser Printer , HL-L2350DW.
customer_reviews.author: HLC78

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install.
customer_reviews.text: The printer was difficult to install and link to our AT&T WiFi router. Called Geek Squad to install. Works intermittently. Talked to Brother support for an hour and a half, reinstalled printer drivers. Rep was helpful but in the end we were not successful. Still, intermittently fails with wireless printing from both the laptop and IPad. Printer cartridge only printed two hundred copies before running dry. Also, this printer has a sleep and deep sleep mode which cannot be turned off or reset requiring a couple of minutes before the printer will begin printing.
customer_reviews.author: Wm. O.

product_meta.title: Brother Compact Monochrome Laser Printer, HL-L2350DW, Wireless Printing, Duplex Two-Sided Printing, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description:
Style:HLL2350DW

Designed for the busy home business or small business owner, the new Brother HL L2350DW compact laser printer is an exceptional business printing solution. Engineered with the latest technology, this compact, yet highly diverse laser printer delivers class leading printing speeds of up to 32 pages per minute. It also has automatic duplex (two sided) printing capability, making dual sided printing simple, fast, and efficient. The 250 sheet paper capacity allows busy business owners to improve efficiency and reduce downtime with less paper refills needed.

Quality is enhanced by using Brother Genuine high yield replacement cartridges (TN 760) which can help to reduce operational costs (also compatible with TN 730 replacement toner cartridge). The new compact laser printer from Brother can print on both letter and legal sized paper. It is also infused with modern wireless technology that will permit you to print from smartphones, laptops, tablets, or desktop devices. Also, a built in wireless or USB interface offers users the flexibility to send multiple print jobs to the Brother HL L2350DW at the same time.

Brother is dedicated to superior customer service and stands by our products by offering a 1 year limited warranty on this new compact laser printer. We provide free online, call, or live chat support for the life of your printer. At Brother, we want to ensure that your experience with us is exceptional. If you have been looking for an exceptional compact laser printer with fast printing capacity and multiple user friendly features, add the Brother HL L2350DW to your Amazon shopping cart today.

(1) Based on competing in class monochrome laser printers under 200 dollars. Print speed specifications gathered from manufacturer websites as of 1/9/2017.(2) Requires connection to a wireless network.(3) TN 760 High Yield vs. TN 730 Standard Yield. Up to two times more prints and lower printing costs based on yields and MSRP. Standard Yield and High yield cartridges sold separately.(4) Approx. toner cartridge yield in accordance with ISO/IEC 19752 (letter/A4).(5) Reprinted from PCMag with permission. Copyright 2017 Ziff Davis, LLC. All Rights Reserved.(6) Approx. 300 pages per month in accordance with ISO/IEC 19752 (Letter/A4) using the 2 toners provided in box.(7) The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4.4 or later. Supported Network Protocols (IPv4): ARP, RARP, BOOTP, DHCP, APIPA (Auto IP), WINS/NetBIOS Name Resolution, DNS Resolver, mDNS, LLMNR Responder, LPR/LPD, Custom Raw Port/Port 9100, IPP, FTP Server, SNMPv1/v2c/v3, HTTP Server, TFTP Client and Server, SMTP Client, ICMP, Web Services (Print/Scan), Supported Network Protocols (IPv6): NDP, RA, DNS Resolver, mDNS, LLMNR Responder, LPR/LPD, Custom Raw Port/Port 9100, IPP, FTP Server, SNMPv1/v2c/v3, HTTP Server, TFTP Client and Server, SMTP Client, ICMPv6, LLTD Responder, Web Services (Print/Scan).
feature_bullets: Print more, wait less. Engineered for increased efficiency with class leading print speeds of up to 32 pages per minute1.
Dynamic features accommodate your evolving needs. The 250-sheet paper capacity helps improve efficiency with less refills and handles letter or legal sized paper.
Flexible printing. The manual feed slot offers flexible paper handling for a variety of papers and sizes, such as card stock, envelopes, etc. to help you create professional looking documents.
Printing as mobile as you are. Print wirelessly from your desktop, laptop, smartphone and tablet2.
Connect your way. Versatile connection options with built-in wireless or connect locally to a single computer via its USB interface.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,045 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
